intro: Melampyrum pratense var. castanetorum, commonly known as the Castanea variant of the common touchmiln, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Orobanchaceae. It is a hemiparasitic species, meaning it derives some of its nutrients from the roots of host plants while also performing photosynthesis. This variety is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and meadows. The plant is often found in regions of Europe and parts of Asia, where it thrives in nutrient-rich soils.
